results.title: Poetry for fun: dares and dreams
results.creator_credit: CEF-Central Educational Films and Centron Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces children to poetry. Presents six poems illustrated by cartoon animation and live action photography. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Poetry for an Englishman
results.brief_description: A young girl, living with her family in a lighthouse, is fascinated by her brother’s aloofness and observes his relationship with an English sailor from a distance. Based on a short story, “My brother writes poetry for an Englishman” by Marris Murray. Cast includes Georgina Bradley (Janie), Nathan Dutton (brother), Anna Volska (mother) and John Sheerin (father).

results.title: Poen
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A prose poem read by Leonard Cohen from his novel “Beautiful Losers” to the accompaniment of diverse photographs and other illustrations, with the camera moving in and out of the pictures often with surrealistic effect. He reads four times and each time the effect is different because of his rendition or the accompanying visuals. (Awards: Bilbao, Oberhausen)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josef Reeve, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Partial Assembly
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
This partially assembled Pocket Cinema Camera displays some of the design detail required to achieve accurate, highly toleranced fitment of parts.
Internal components have been miniaturised to ensure the camera is compact enough for hand-held use, but capable of delivering cinematic film quality.

results.title: Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Form Prototype
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This full colour 3D print is made from a powdered material solidified by an inkjet printing process over hundreds of layers. It was created using data from sophisticated 3D CAD software. Built by the Industrial Design Team, it was used during the early stages of the design process to evaluate the camera’s ergonomics and design.

results.title: Pocket Cinema Camera 6K
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
The Pocket Cinema Camera 6K is the world’s lightest and most portable 6K digital film camera, designed specifically for independant filmmakers, TV and web broadcasters.

It offers Hollywood image quality and professional features in an affordable, ultra-portable and familiar DSLR format.
results.description:

results.title: Pocket Cinema Camera 6K
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: What do the Avengers, Jason Bourne and the Expendables have in common? Aside from heroes saving the day, these film franchises all feature frenetic action sequences filmed on the BlackMagic Pocket Cinema Camera. The key isn’t just the Hollywood-quality 6K resolution (it helps though), but the size of the camera. Filmmakers have strapped them to motorbikes, cars, trucks, boats and even tanks, with their size allowing minimal rigging and creative approaches to capturing breathtaking action. What also helps is that they’re made from carbon fibre/polycarbonate composite material so they’re super strong but also lightweight. First sketched out and designed on 3D CAD (Computer Assisted Design) software, prototypes are then made from 3D prints while the internal components are miniaturised to ensure hand-held use without losing their cinematic quality.

results.title: Pocahontas (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Eric Goldberg, Mike Gabriel, James Pentecost and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The legendary tale of the meeting of Pocahontas, American Indian Princess, and Captain John Smith is vividly recreated with the Disney recipe for success; two cheeky animal companions, the racoon Meeko and hummingbird Flit, vibrant colours and captivating music. A film for the family to enjoy as Pocahontas learns to listen to her heart. Features the Academy Award winning score of Alan Menken and Stephen Schwartz.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Goldberg, Mike Gabriel, James Pentecost and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: Pocahontas
results.creator_credit: Eric Goldberg, Mike Gabriel, James Pentecost and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The legendary tale of the meeting of Pocahontas, American Indian Princess, and Captain John Smith is vividly recreated with the Disney recipe for success; two cheeky animal companions, the racoon Meeko and hummingbird Flit, vibrant colours and captivating music. A film for the family to enjoy as Pocahontas learns to listen to her heart. Features the Academy Award winning score of Alan Menken and Stephen Schwartz. Featuring the voices of Mel Gibson, Irene Bedard, Judy Kuhn, David Ogden Stiers, Linda Hunt, Christian Bale, John Kassir, Billy Connolly.
